quotes.text: A specter is haunting the modern world, the specter of crypto anarchy.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: The State will of course try to slow or halt the spread of this technology, citing national security concerns, use of the technology by drug dealers and tax evaders, and fears of societal disintegration.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Computer technology is on the verge of providing the ability for individuals and groups to communicate and interact with each other in a totally anonymous manner.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Just as the technology of printing altered and reduced the power of medieval guilds and the social power structure, so too will cryptologic methods fundamentally alter the nature of corporations and of government interference in economic transactions.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Crypto anarchy is not just about avoiding laws. It's about making certain laws unenforceable, and hence making them obsolete.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Privacy is necessary for an open society in the electronic age.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.text: Cypherpunks write code. We know that someone has to write software to defend privacy, and since we can't get privacy unless we all do, we're going to write it.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.text: Privacy is not secrecy. A private matter is something one doesn't want the whole world to know, but a secret matter is something one doesn't want anybody to know. Privacy is the power to selectively reveal oneself to the world.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.text: We cannot expect governments, corporations, or other large, faceless organizations to grant us privacy out of their beneficence.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.text: We must defend our own privacy if we expect to have any. We must come together and create systems which allow anonymous transactions to take place.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.text: Capable, generous men do not create victims, they nurture them.
quotes.author: Julian Assange
quotes.source: Cypherpunks: Freedom and the Future of the Internet

quotes.text: Every time we witness an injustice and do not act, we train our character to be passive in its presence and thereby eventually lose all ability to defend ourselves and those we love.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: The internet, our greatest tool of emancipation, has been transformed into the most dangerous facilitator of totalitarianism we have ever seen.
quotes.author: Julian Assange
quotes.source: Cypherpunks: Freedom and the Future of the Internet

quotes.text: If privacy is outlawed, only outlaws will have privacy.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: Pretty Good Privacy empowers people to take their privacy into their own hands. There has been a growing social need for it.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: There is nothing quite so disempowering as a government that can read all your most intimate thoughts and correspondence.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: What if everyone believed that law-abiding citizens should use postcards for their mail? If a nonconformist tried to assert his privacy by using an envelope, it would draw suspicion.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: You can pay for access to a database, download a program, or have a prescription filled — without anyone being able to trace the transaction back to you.
quotes.author: David Chaum

quotes.text: I am very concerned that large transaction systems are being designed with no regard for privacy. Once in place they could lead to a world in which all transactions are tracked.
quotes.author: David Chaum

quotes.text: In one direction lies unprecedented scrutiny and control of people's lives; in the other, secure parity between individuals and organizations. The shape of society in the next century may depend on which approach predominates.
quotes.author: David Chaum
quotes.source: Security Without Identification: Transaction Systems to Make Big Brother Obsolete

quotes.text: I see Bitcoin as ultimately becoming a reserve currency for banks, playing much the same role as gold did in the early days of banking.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: I'd like to think that decades from now, people will look back and see this time as the dawning of a new era of individual empowerment and freedom.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: For Bitcoin to succeed and become secure, bitcoins must become vastly more expensive.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: When Satoshi announced Bitcoin on the cryptography mailing list, he got a skeptical reception at best. Cryptographers have seen too many grand schemes by clueless noobs.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: Bitcoin seems to be a very promising idea. I like the idea of basing security on the assumption that the CPU power of honest participants outweighs that of the attacker.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: I would like to die peacefully in my sleep, knowing that I helped create a better world for those who come after me.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.text: I am fascinated by Tim May's crypto-anarchy. Unlike the communities traditionally associated with the word 'anarchy', in a crypto-anarchy the government is not temporarily destroyed but permanently forbidden and permanently unnecessary.
quotes.author: Wei Dai

quotes.text: Trusted third parties are security holes.
quotes.author: Nick Szabo
quotes.source: Trusted Third Parties are Security Holes

quotes.text: A smart contract is a set of promises, specified in digital form, including protocols within which the parties perform on these promises.
quotes.author: Nick Szabo
quotes.source: Smart Contracts: Building Blocks for Digital Markets

quotes.text: Advances in information technology have made possible the rise of a truly international currency that does not depend on a central bank.
quotes.author: Nick Szabo

quotes.text: Money, like written language, was one of the most important inventions of civilization.
quotes.author: Nick Szabo
quotes.source: Shelling Out: The Origins of Money

quotes.text: Governments of the Industrial World, you weary giants of flesh and steel, I come from Cyberspace, the new home of Mind.
quotes.author: John Perry Barlow
quotes.source: A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace

quotes.text: Cyberspace consists of transactions, relationships, and thought itself, arrayed like a standing wave in the web of our communications. Ours is a world that is both everywhere and nowhere, but it is not where bodies live.
quotes.author: John Perry Barlow
quotes.source: A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace

quotes.text: You claim there are problems among us that you need to solve. You use this claim as an excuse to invade our precincts.
quotes.author: John Perry Barlow
quotes.source: A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace

quotes.text: We are creating a world where anyone, anywhere may express his or her beliefs, no matter how singular, without fear of being coerced into silence or conformity.
quotes.author: John Perry Barlow
quotes.source: A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace

quotes.text: Arguing that you don't care about the right to privacy because you have nothing to hide is no different than saying you don't care about free speech because you have nothing to say.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: I don't want to live in a world where everything I do and say is recorded. That is not something I am willing to support or live under.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: The NSA has built an infrastructure that allows it to intercept almost everything. With this capability, the vast majority of human communications are automatically ingested without targeting.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: Being a patriot doesn't mean prioritizing service to government above all else. Being a patriot means knowing when to protect your country, knowing when to protect your Constitution, knowing when to protect your countrymen, from the violations of and encroachments of adversaries.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: Encryption works. Properly implemented strong crypto systems are one of the few things that you can rely on.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: The best defense against abusive government is an informed and active citizenry.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: Public key cryptography is a revolution that puts control of privacy into the hands of the individual.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: Bitcoin is the most significant computer science breakthrough in the last 20 years.
quotes.author: Adam Back

quotes.text: The age of the printable gun has arrived, and there's nothing anyone can do about it.
quotes.author: Cody Wilson

quotes.text: I wanted to empower people to make their own choices, to pursue their own happiness.
quotes.author: Ross Ulbricht

quotes.text: Every action I took was out of a desire to enable people to have freedom and control over their own lives.
quotes.author: Ross Ulbricht

quotes.text: We live in a golden age for surveillance. Everything you do can be captured.
quotes.author: Jacob Appelbaum

quotes.text: Free software is a matter of liberty, not price. To understand the concept, you should think of 'free' as in 'free speech,' not as in 'free beer.'
quotes.author: Richard Stallman

quotes.text: Proprietary software is an injustice. It denies users freedom and keeps them divided and helpless.
quotes.author: Richard Stallman

quotes.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: Information is power. But like all power, there are those who want to keep it for themselves.
quotes.author: Aaron Swartz

quotes.text: There is no justice in following unjust laws. It's time to come into the light and, in the grand tradition of civil disobedience, declare our opposition to this private theft of public culture.
quotes.author: Aaron Swartz

quotes.text: Anyone who says they have a system that's perfectly secure from attackers is lying.
quotes.author: Cory Doctorow

quotes.text: Security is a process, not a product.
quotes.author: Bruce Schneier

quotes.text: If you think technology can solve your security problems, then you don't understand the problems and you don't understand the technology.
quotes.author: Bruce Schneier

quotes.text: Cryptography is the last defense of liberty in a world of total surveillance.
quotes.author: Bruce Schneier

quotes.text: Bitcoin isn't just money for the internet. It's a new form of money that is native to the internet.
quotes.author: Andreas Antonopoulos

quotes.text: Bitcoin is not just a currency. It's a platform for trust.
quotes.author: Andreas Antonopoulos

quotes.text: The simplest open protocol that is able to create a censorship-resistant global social network.
quotes.author: fiatjaf

quotes.text: The ecosystem is moving towards consolidation because users don't want to run their own servers.
quotes.author: Moxie Marlinspike

quotes.text: End-to-end encryption should be the default for all communication.
quotes.author: Moxie Marlinspike

quotes.text: Strong cryptography can resist an unlimited amount of violence. No amount of coercive force will ever solve a math problem.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Cryptography is the ultimate form of non-violent direct action.
quotes.author: Julian Assange
quotes.source: Cypherpunks: Freedom and the Future of the Internet

quotes.text: Those with access to these resources — students, librarians, scientists — have been given an enormous privilege. You get to feed at this banquet of knowledge while the rest of the world is locked out.
quotes.author: Aaron Swartz

quotes.text: I believed in the idea of giving people the freedom to buy and sell and connect with each other without the all-seeing eye of government watching every move.
quotes.author: Ross Ulbricht

quotes.text: The Net interprets censorship as damage and routes around it.
quotes.author: John Gilmore

quotes.text: User-controlled privacy is not a niche; it's a fundamental building block of a healthy and stable society.
quotes.author: Zooko Wilcox

quotes.text: Privacy is the foundation that allows freedom of speech, thought, and association to thrive. Without it, these freedoms exist only on paper and can't be exercised in practice in a meaningful way.
quotes.author: Zooko Wilcox

quotes.text: I can't speak for what Satoshi intended, but I sure don't think it involved bitcoin exchanges that have draconian rules about KYC, AML, passports, freezes on accounts and laws about reporting 'suspicious activity' to the local secret police.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: There's a real possibility that all the noise about 'governance,' 'regulation' and 'blockchain' will effectively create a surveillance state, a dossier society.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: I think the greed and hype and nattering about 'to the Moon!' and 'HODL' is the biggest hype wagon I've ever seen.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Be interested in liberty and the freedom to transact and speak to get back to the original motivations. Don't spend time trying to make government-friendly financial alternatives.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Mathematics is not the law.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: Remember, there are a lot tyrants out there.
quotes.author: Tim May

quotes.text: You use envelopes for postal mail. You use it for love letters, business letters and your medical records. The only way to create the digital equivalent of an envelope is to encrypt.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: Most people are unaware of how visible email is. Email could be intercepted by a lot of parties along the way, it could be captured and logged, scanned and then used years later.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: In view of the serious implications of such a law, I abandoned my plans to charge for PGP in the hopes of achieving wider distribution.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: I am active in policy space rather writing code, doing a lot of public speaking. There is a lot of need for activism now in the shadow of the Patriot Act.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: I am an engineer, not a mathematician. I try to find practical solutions to actual problems.
quotes.author: Philip Zimmermann

quotes.text: What is the greatest unsolved problem in cryptography today? Lack of user awareness.
quotes.author: Martin Hellman

quotes.text: Building security from day one is much easier than adding it on as an afterthought.
quotes.author: Martin Hellman

quotes.text: I have argued that the Internet should have had security built into it from the very beginning, where every email message was authenticated with a signature, and that there was an adequate public key infrastructure in place.
quotes.author: Martin Hellman

quotes.text: When a company goes to develop a product, that has only two options, secure or insecure, they should, from day one, define the product as either secure or insecure.
quotes.author: Martin Hellman

quotes.text: The real value in encryption and the real threat to intelligence operations, both law enforcement and national security, is integrated, automatic encryption.
quotes.author: Martin Hellman

quotes.text: I had this view of cryptography in which the critical value of cryptography was that you didn't have to trust other people.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: If you encrypted your files, then if a court wanted your files they would have to come and threaten you and you would have the control to make the choice as to whether you would surrender your files or not.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: I never understood the classical notion of a key distribution center, which is a trusted resource that you have to share.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: Cryptography was a technique that did not require your trusting other people.
quotes.author: Whitfield Diffie

quotes.text: A hash function should be a one-way function — easy to compute but difficult to reverse.
quotes.author: Ralph Merkle

quotes.text: Bulk collection, which should become one of the dirtiest phrases in the language if we have any kind of decency.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: It's not data that's being exploited. It's people that are being exploited. It's not data that's being manipulated, it's you that's being manipulated.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: The scandal isn't how they're breaking the law. The scandal is that they don't have to break the law.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: They have built a legal paradigm that presumes records collected about us do not belong to us.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: You can't awaken someone who's pretending to be asleep.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.text: That's why our primary defense isn't law, but technology.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: Courage is contagious. If you demonstrate that individuals can leak something and go on to live a good life, it's tremendously incentivizing to people.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: Intelligence agencies keep things secret because they often violate the rule of law or of good behavior.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: Stopping leaks is a new form of censorship. And in the same manner that very significant resources spent on China's firewall, the result is that anyone who's motivated can work around it.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: The supply of leaks is very large. It's helpful for us to have more people in this industry. It's protective to us.
quotes.author: Julian Assange
